text: Desmarestiales is an order in the brown algae (Phaeophyceae). Members of this order have terete or ligulate (flat) pinnately branched thalli attached by discoid holdfasts. They have a sporphytic thallus usually aggregated to form a pseudo-parenchyma.Pound F.E. 1962 “The Biology of the Algae” Edward Arnold Ltd. The order gets its name from the genus Desmarestia, which is named after the French zoologist Anselme Gaëtan Desmarest (1784–1838).Genaust, Helmut (1976). Etymologisches Wörterbuch der botanischen Pflanzennamen As the general name of the class suggests, their pigmentation is brown. ==References== ==Further reading== ==External links== * AlgaeBase Category:Brown algae orders
title: Desmarestiales
